SENT.plain: A 71-year-old man experienced sudden onset of hemiparesis and aphasia
He had a 4-month history of gallbladder cholangiocarcinoma, complicated with a postoperative deep-vein thrombosis (DVT) that necessitated a vena caval filter placement
Diffusion-weighted magnetic resonance imaging of the brain showed multiple hyperintense foci
Magnetic resonance spectroscopy was compatible with cerebral infarction
Abdominal computed tomography showed a thrombus in the inferior vena cava extending through the filters
A transcranial Doppler bubble study revealed the presence of a right-to-left shunt
Paradoxical cerebral embolism must be considered in patients with DVT who have new onset neurologic deficits even in the presence of a caval filter
